N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 411.7 - Notifications of cancellation, suspension or refusal to register

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 283(6)
(a) A notice of proposed cancellation or
suspension of registration or a notice of proposed refusal to register will be
sent by registered or certified mail to the registrant or applicant
respectively at its last known address reflected on its application for
registration as a distributor of motor fuel or the address reflected on its
last return filed with the Department of Taxation and Finance. Such
notifications will outline the basis for cancellation or suspension of a
registration or the basis for refusal to register and contain a statement to
the effect that the impending cancellation, suspension or refusal may be
protested through a hearing process and that a petition for such protest must
be filed within 90 days after the date of such notice. Where a timely
application for a hearing to protest a proposed cancellation, suspension or
denial of a registration as a distributor of motor fuel is made, a hearing will
be scheduled and conducted in accordance with the Tax Appeals Tribunal's
procedures. (b) In the case of a
person applying for registration as a distributor of motor fuel, a notice of
proposed refusal to register will be issued promptly after the application for
the registration is received by the Department of Taxation and

Finance. (c) Unless acts involving
falsity or fraud are at issue, a notice of proposed cancellation or suspension
of registration or of proposed refusal to register must be issued within five
years from the date of the act or omission which formed the basis for such
cancellation, suspension or denial. (See sections
411.5
and
411.6
of this Part.) Where acts involving falsity or fraud are at issue, such notices
may be issued at any time. (d) Where a registration is cancelled or suspended prior to a hearing, the
cancellation or suspension may be protested through the hearing process, provided a petition for such protest is filed within 90 days after the date of
the notice of cancellation or suspension. (e) For hearing procedures see Part 3000 of
this Title. Notes
